title: WATCH: Souness on 'pathetic' Amrabat
text:
WATCH: Graeme Souness on 'pathetic' defending from Watford's Nordin Amrabat Last Updated: 01/01/17 10:25pm Graeme Souness was not impressed with the defending from Watford's Nordin Amrabat for Tottenham's fourth goal on Super Sunday. 
Walter Mazzarri's team were 3-0 down at half-time of their New Year's Day Premier League clash and Dele Alli added his second - and Spurs' fourth - barely a minute after the interval as they cruised to a 4-1 win. 
And when analysing the goal on Super Sunday, Sky Sports pundit Souness was furious with Amrabat's reluctance to track the run of the England midfielder, calling it "pathetic" and "a joke". Watford 1-4 Tottenham 
"They gave up defending right after half-time," he said. 
"Amrabat was looking at the whole picture and must see Dele Alli make that run. 
"'Should I? No, we're three down, forget it and let's got four down'. That is pathetic. 
"You talk about being part of a team and busting a gut for the cause, but that is the exact opposite. 
"It's a joke. It's right after half-time. It's not like it's the 92nd minute and he's tired." 
Watch the incident for yourself at the top of the page and listen to Souness' words. Also See:
